availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Abner (Green County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier. Smith County, Tennessee, native. Married to Anna E. McAfee Abner. Father of James Nathan Abner and William L. Abner. Laborer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 35th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from October 2, 1863 to November 12, 1864. Died of smallpox in Lexington on November 12, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 605.

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994036, Green County Births.
